adjectives.description: skeptical (comparative more skeptical, superlative most skeptical) (American spelling)

examples: My teacher was skeptical when I told her my dog ate my homework.
I can see why people are so skeptical [sic] about him, but I think he's on to something here. (regarded by organizations such as the BBC as an error)
Tom was skeptical when Paul told him that he saw Bigfoot.

entries.meaning: Of or relating to philosophical skepticism or the skeptics.
